item.description: A threat actor we track under the Intrusion set Water Curupira (known to employ the Black Basta ransomware) has been actively using Pikabot. a loader malware with similarities to Qakbot, in spam campaigns throughout 2023.

item.title: Web Security Expands into Secure Service Edge (SSE)
item.description: Trend has been securing web access for over a decade with forward-looking innovation and a global footprint to support our customer’s security strategy. We are committed to our customers’ journey of transforming their current security posture, aligning with Zero Trust principles, and embracing a modern, fully integrated security architecture.
category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: 2023 Review: Reflecting on Cybersecurity Trends
item.description: Every year, experts weigh in with predictions of what the big cybersecurity trends will be—but how often are they right? That’s the question Trend Micro’s Greg Young and Bill Malik asked recently on their Real Cybersecurity podcast, looking at what forecasters got wrong on a wide range of topics, from AI to human factors.

William Malik

item.title: Opening Critical Infrastructure: The Current State of Open RAN Security
item.description: The Open Radio Access Network (ORAN) architecture provides standardized interfaces and protocols to previously closed systems. However, our research on ORAN demonstrates the potential threat posed by malicious xApps that are capable of compromising the entire Ran Intelligent Controller (RIC) subsystem.

Richard Y Lin

item.title: DarkGate Opens Organizations for Attack via Skype, Teams

item.title: APT34 Deploys Phishing Attack With New Malware
item.description: We observed and tracked the advanced persistent threat (APT) APT34 group with a new malware variant accompanying a phishing attack comparatively similar to the SideTwist backdoor malware. Following the campaign, the group abused a fake license registration form of an African government agency to target a victim in Saudi Arabia.

Mahmoud Zohdy

item.title: Decoding Turla: Trend Micro's MITRE Performance

item.title: Attacks on 5G Infrastructure From Users’ Devices
item.description: Crafted packets from cellular devices such as mobile phones can exploit faulty state machines in the 5G core to attack cellular infrastructure. Smart devices that critical industries such as defense, utilities, and the medical sectors use for their daily operations depend on the speed, efficiency, and productivity brought by 5G. This entry describes CVE-2021-45462 as a potential use case to deploy a denial-of-service (DoS) attack to private 5G networks.
item.dc:creator: Salim S.I.
category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks

item.title: Earth Lusca Employs New Linux Backdoor, Uses Cobalt Strike for Lateral Movement
item.description: While monitoring Earth Lusca, we discovered an intriguing, encrypted file on the threat actor's server — a Linux-based malware, which appears to originate from the open-source Windows backdoor Trochilus, which we've dubbed SprySOCKS due to its swift behavior and SOCKS implementation.

Jaromir Horejsi

item.description: Since its initial release in late 2022, the AI-powered text generation tool known as ChatGPT has been experiencing rapid adoption rates from both organizations and individual users. item.title: Malvertising Used as Entry Vector for BlackCat, Actors Also Leverage SpyBoy Terminator
item.description: We found that malicious actors used malvertising to distribute malware via cloned webpages of legitimate organizations. The distribution involved a webpage of the well-known application WinSCP, an open-source Windows application for file transfer. We were able to identify that this activity led to a BlackCat (aka ALPHV) infection, and actors also used SpyBoy, a terminator that tampers with protection provided by agents.

RonJay Caragay
Arianne Dela Cruz
Gabriel Cardoso

item.description: The Trigona ransomware is a relatively new ransomware family that began activities around late October 2022 — although samples of it existed as early as June 2022. item.title: SeroXen Incorporates Latest BatCloak Engine Iteration
item.description: We looked into the documented behavior of SeroXen malware and noted the inclusion of the latest iteration of the batch obfuscation engine BatCloak to generate a fully undetectable (FUD) .bat loader. This is the second part of a three-part series documenting the abuse of BatCloak’s evasion capabilities and interoperability with other malware.
dc:creator: Peter Girnus
Aliakbar Zahravi
category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: To Fight Cyber Extortion and Ransomware, Shift Left
item.description: How can organizations defend themselves more effectively against ransomware and other forms of cyber extortion? By “shifting left” and adopting proactive cybersecurity strategies to detect attacks sooner, mitigating breaches before they cause harm.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Attack Surface Management Strategies
item.description: As organizations shift to the cloud in droves, their digital attack surface continues to rapidly expand. We explore how proactive cyber risk management can help harden your defenses and reduce the likelihood of an attack or breach.

item.title: Behind the Scenes: Unveiling the Hidden Workings of Earth Preta
item.description: This blog entry discusses the more technical details on the most recent tools, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) leveraged by the Earth Preta APT group, and tackles how we were able to correlate different indicators connected to this threat actor.

item.title: Analyzing the FUD Malware Obfuscation Engine BatCloak
item.description: We look into BatCloak engine, its modular integration into modern malware, proliferation mechanisms, and interoperability implications as malicious actors take advantage of its fully undetectable (FUD) capabilities.

item.title: Impulse Team’s Massive Years-Long Mostly-Undetected Cryptocurrency Scam
item.description: We have been able to uncover a massive cryptocurrency scam involving more than a thousand websites handled by different affiliates linked to a program called Impulse Project, run by a threat actor named Impulse Team.
dc:creator: Cedric Pernet
Joseph C Chen

item.title: Xollam, the Latest Face of TargetCompany
item.description: This blog talks about the latest TargetCompany ransomware variant, Xollam, and the new initial access technique it uses. We also investigate previous variants' behaviors and the ransomware family's extortion scheme.

item.title: Trend is a Launch Partner for Amazon Security Lake
